thread.title: BARBARA

author: BARBARA
title: BARBARA
text: We took this trip to rural Mexico expecting a large amount of bus riding because the Copper Canyon is remote. Globus booked us into very nice hotels with excellent restaurants. Our only complaint was not with Globus but with the road department in Mexico. They were putting in a new highway and do not operate like the US. We were on a dirt road for about three hours. Tour buses and semi-trucks should never been allowed on that road. I think the tour director was almost as shocked as we were. Nevertheless The Copper Canyon is spectacular and well worth seeing.
